title: Keir Starmer's Big Problem: Losing His Top Helper
summary: Keir Starmer, the leader of the UK, is in a tough spot because his chief of staff, Morgan McSweeney, has left. McSweeney was Starmer's close helper for many years, helping him become leader and win elections. Now, without McSweeney, Starmer feels angry and knows he made a mistake by trusting someone who told lies. People in his party are worried because McSweeney took blame for problems, and without him, Starmer might face more trouble. The article explains that Starmer's situation is very serious, and everyone agrees he is in danger. We will see how he handles things on his own.

background_read: Keir Starmer is the leader of the UK and head of the Labour Party. He became prime minister after winning an election in 2024. A chief of staff is an important helper who gives advice and manages things for a leader. In politics, people often work in teams, and losing a key member can cause problems. This article talks about how Starmer is dealing with losing his top helper and the challenges he faces.
Article_Structure: WHO: Keir Starmer, the UK leader, and Morgan McSweeney, his former chief of staff
WHAT: Starmer is in a dire predicament after McSweeney left, feeling angry and facing danger without his helper
WHERE: In the UK government and Labour Party
WHY: To show how losing a key team member affects a leader and creates uncertainty

perspectives.description: Some Labour MPs miss McSweeney and think he was brilliant and motivating, helping the party succeed.
Others believe McSweeney was involved in government mistakes, so his departure might not be all bad.
